operation.descriptionCdata:
7b252699-89b4-4075-ac90-9be5f7e7569c.004cb384-60e2-4b35-8bfe-6c6d4e237e5c.prompt=Give the host of the destination file\: 7b252699-89b4-4075-ac90-9be5f7e7569c.0ebfa0d9-d7f2-481f-b294-c5a02903c429.prompt=Give the host of the source file\: 7b252699-89b4-4075-ac90-9be5f7e7569c.289257d5-c13c-4ef5-857f-eec219be8b18.prompt=Give the protocol used to copy from the source file\: 7b252699-89b4-4075-ac90-9be5f7e7569c.8f2782c5-7ae2-4977-90ec-b2513bff8bfc.prompt=Give the path to the destination file\: 7b252699-89b4-4075-ac90-9be5f7e7569c.b6026aa0-8b13-4075-8e20-205073cfcca1.prompt=Give the path to the source file\: 7b252699-89b4-4075-ac90-9be5f7e7569c.description=This operation copies files between two remote machines using different protocols (local, SCP, FTP, SFTP, SMB, SMB2 or SMB3).

Inputs\:
 sourceHost - The host of the source file.
 sourcePort - The port for connecting to the source host.
 sourceUsername - The username for connecting to the host of the source file.
 sourcePassword - The password for connecting to the host of the source file.
 sourcePrivateKeyFile - Absolute path of the private key file for public/private key authentication on the source host.
 sourcePath - The absolute path to the source file. In case of FTP or SFTP protocol please use a relativ path to FTP/SFTP server root directory.
 sourceProtocol - The protocol used to copy from the source file. When transferring files through the SMB protocol it is recommended to use SMB version 3 as versions 1 and 2 are considered less secure. This capability is provided “as is”, please see product documentation for further information.
Valid values\: local, SCP, FTP, SFTP, SMB, SMB2 or SMB3.
 sourceCharacterSet - The name of the control encoding to use with source host for FTP and SFTP protocols. 
Examples\: UTF-8, EUC-JP, SJIS. 
Default\: for FTP, the default is ISO-8859-1 (Latin1). For SFTP, it is UTF-8.
 destinationHost - The host of the destination file.
 destinationPort - The port for connecting to the destination host.
 destinationUsername - The username for connecting to the host of the destination file.
 destinationPassword - The password for connecting to the host of the destination file.
 destinationPrivateKeyFile - Absolute path of the private key file for public/private key authentication on the destination host.
 destinationPath - The absolute path to the destination file.
When using SMB v2, SMB v3 the destination path should start with the samba shared folder. In order to obtain a samba shared folder, the user must configure a specific folder to be shared with one or more remote users. For more information please check the official Microsoft SMB documentation. 
Example\: sambaSharedFolder\folder1\folder2\file.
 destinationProtocol - The protocol used to copy to the destination file. When transferring files through the SMB protocol it is recommended to use SMB version 3 as versions 1 and 2 are considered less secure. This capability is provided “as is”, please see product documentation for further information.
Valid values\: local, SCP, FTP, SFTP, SMB, SMB2 or SMB3.
 destinationCharacterSet - The name of the control encoding to use with destination host for FTP and SFTP protocols. 
Examples\: UTF-8, EUC-JP, SJIS. 
Default\: for FTP, the default is ISO-8859-1 (Latin1). For SFTP, it is UTF-8.
 fileType - The type of the file being copied if using FTP. This input must be empty if FTP protocol is not used.
Valid values\: binary, ascii.
Default value\: binary
 passive - If true, passive connection mode will be enabled if using FTP.
Valid values\: true, false.
Default value\: false

Results\:
 returnResult - This is the primary output and contains the "Copy completed successfully" message if operation successfully completes, or an exception message otherwise.
 returnCode - It is 0 if operation successfully completes, -1 otherwise.
 exception - It contains an exception message if something went wrong.

Responses\:
 success - The file was copied successfully.
 failure - The file could not be copied.
 
Examples\:
1. The following is a valid inputs example for copying a file from a Windows machine to a Linux machine\:
 sourceHost\: server1.example.com
 sourcePort\: 22
 sourceUsername\: username1
 sourcePasword\: password1
 sourcePath\: C\:\Program Files\example.txt
 sourceProtocol\: scp
 destinationHost\: server2.example.com
 destinationPort\: 22
 destinationUsername\: username2
 destinationPassword\: password2
 destinationPath\: /root/example.txt
 destinationProtocol\: scp
2. The following is a valid inputs example for copying a file from a Linux machine to a Windows machine\:
 sourceHost\: server2.example.com
 sourcePort\: 22
 sourceUsername\: username2
 sourcePasword\: password2
 sourcePath\: /root/example.txt
 sourceProtocol\: scp
 destinationHost\: server1.example.com
 destinationPort\: 22
 destinationUsername\: username1
 destinationPassword\: password1
 destinationPath\: C\:\Program Files\example.txt
 destinationProtocol\: scp
3. The following is a valid inputs example for copying a file from a Linux machine to a Windows machine without prerequisites\:
 sourceHost\: server2.example.com
 sourcePort\: 22
 sourceUsername\: username2
 sourcePasword\: password2
 sourcePath\: /root/example.txt
 sourceProtocol\: scp
 destinationHost\: server1.example.com
 destinationUsername\: username1
 destinationPassword\: password1
 destinationPath\: C\:\Program Files\example.txt
 destinationProtocol\: smb
4. The following is a valid inputs example for copying a file using SMB v2 or SMB v3\:
 sourceHost\: server2.example.com
 sourcePort\: 22
 sourceUsername\: username2
 sourcePasword\: password2
 sourcePath\: /root/example.txt
 sourceProtocol\: scp
 destinationHost\: server1.example.com
 destinationUsername\: username1
 destinationPassword\: password1
 destinationPath\: sambaSharedFolder\example.txt 7b252699-89b4-4075-ac90-9be5f7e7569c.f132b751-0a3d-4537-aee7-7b3f400b92f6.prompt=Give the protocol used to copy to the destination file\:
operation.name: Remote Copy
